learning_outcomes.description: Describe and analyse the conceptual and methodological issues in recognising revenue and in accounting for topics such as company income taxes, non-current tangible and intangible assets, leases, subsequent events, extractive industries, revenue recognition, employee benefits, financial instruments and foreign currency transactions.
Discuss national and international influences on the regulation of financial reporting by listed companies.
Implement and evaluate the requirements of accounting standards and other regulations that govern accounting practice.
Analyse specific situations and transactions, presented as a case study, and identify applicable accounting regulations and financial statement consequences.
Understand and interpret reports including non-financial data and information such as sustainability reports, integrated reports and extended external reporting.

assessments.task_description:
The in-semester exam will cover the topics 1-4 and consists of problem solving and theory questions.

The in-semester exam will be a closed book exam invigilated on campus and timed to 1.5 hours with an additional 10 minutes perusal time.

If you are unable to sit your exam, you must apply for a deferred exam.

AI Statement:

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
You are required to independently prepare a case study report.

The case will be used to examine your research skills, professional writing skills, general accounting knowledge, and the ability to critically source and evaluate complex case scenarios.

Full details of the assignment will be provided via the course Blackboard site.

AI Statement:

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The case study assignment is to be submitted online through Turnitin on the course Blackboard site. The submission instructions will be provided with the case study assignment questions.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The final exam will cover the topics 5, 8 -11 and consists of problem solving and theory questions.

The final exam will be a closed book exam invigilated on campus and timed to 2 hours with an additional 10 minutes perusal time. Information regarding more details of the exam will be provided in the revision lecture.

If you are unable to sit your exam, you must apply for a deferred exam.

AI Statement

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
